Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of how speech is produced, how it is transformed into an acoustic signal, and how that acoustic signal is measured as well as laboratory techniques used in investigating human speech perception.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A case study approach to communicative-cognitive processes and disorders in brain injury.

SPA3471 - Communication Disorders in Lit.name: SPA3471 - Communication Disorders in Literature and Media

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Exploration of communication disorders in literature and media, emphasizing psychosocial, academic, vocational, and familial challenges as well as society's perceptions of individuals with communication disorders.

College.text: College of Health Professions and Sciences

SPA3472 - Behavioral Methods in Communic.name: SPA3472 - Behavioral Methods in Communication Disorders

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Evidence-based methods addressing behavioral, social/emotional, and communication challenges of persons with communicative disorders. Design, implement and evaluate behavioral methods, intervention plans, and therapeutic goals for children with communicative disorders.

Course Description.text: Physics of sound, anatomy of hearing mechanism, pure tone audiometry, hearing aids, problems of the deaf and hard of hearing. Clinical skills development required.

SPA4326 - Hearing Disorders Across the L.name: SPA4326 - Hearing Disorders Across the Lifespan

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: SPA 3011 or SPA 3011C and SPA 4032 and Senior Standing or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Primary and secondary consequences of hearing loss across the lifespan including hearing impairments and communication limitations.

SPA4400 - Language Disorders Across the.name: SPA4400 - Language Disorders Across the Life Span

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: LIN 3716 and Junior Standing, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Etiology, assessment, and management of language disorders in children, adolescents, and adults, including those associated with autism, traumatic brain injury, learning disabilities, and dementia.

SPA4476 - Speech Disorders Across the Li.name: SPA4476 - Speech Disorders Across the Lifespan

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: SPA 3101, and SPA 3112C and Junior Standing, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Causes and characteristics of speech and swallowing disorders in children and adults, including those affecting articulation, phonation, resonance, fluency, and feeding and swallowing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Cultural and linguistic diversity among individuals with communication disorders and differences. Special emphasis on African, Hispanic, Asian, and Native American.
